{{Infobox XC3 Enemy |name = Crazed Igna |image = |caption = Crazed Igna |category = Normal Minor Enemy |type = [[Igna]] |level = 45
96-99 |area = [[Elaice Highway]] ([[Igna Conglomerate]])
[[Erythia Sea]] ([[Rebellion Cave]]) |spawntime = Anytime |respawn = Yes |movement = |detection = |exp = |cp = |sp = }} '''Crazed Ignas''' are Normal Minor Enemies in {{XC3}}. They are members of the [[Igna]] family, and can be found at level 45 at the [[Igna Conglomerate]] on [[Elaice Highway]], and level 96-99 in [[Rebellion Cave]] at [[Erythia Sea]] in the [[Cadensia Region]]. {{clr}} == In {{XC3FR|sub}} == {{Infobox XC3 Enemy |name = Crazed Igna |image = Crazed Igna FR.jpg |caption = Crazed Igna |category = Normal Minor Enemy |type = [[Igna]] |level = 20 |area = [[Aurora Shelf]] |spawntime = Anytime |respawn = Yes |movement = |detection = |exp = }} '''Crazed Ignas''' are Normal Minor Enemies in {{XC3FR}}. They are members of the [[Igna]] family, and can be found at level 20 on the [[Aurora Shelf]]. {{clr}} {{xc3 stub}} {{Fr stub}} [[Category:XC3 Minor Enemies]] [[Category:XC3FR Minor Enemies]] [[Category:Fornis Region Enemies]] [[Category:Cadensia Region Enemies]] [[Category:Aurora Shelf Enemies]] [[Category:XC3 Level 41-45 Enemies]] [[Category:XC3 Level 96-100 Enemies]] [[Category:XC3FR Level 16-20 Enemies]] [[Category:XC3 Ignas]] [[Category:XC3FR Ignas]] [[Category:XC3 Challenge Battle Enemies]] [[Category:XC3 Enemy pages needing an infobox image]] [[Category:XC3 Enemy pages needing stats]] [[Category:XC3 Enemy pages needing drops]] [[Category:XC3FR Enemy pages needing stats]] [[Category:XC3FR Enemy pages needing drops]]

{{Infobox XC3 Enemy |category = Unique Monster |name = Creeping Hameel |image = XC3 Creeping Hameel.png |caption = Creeping Hameel |type = [[Flak]] |level = 67 |area = [[Origin Interior]] ([[Amplifier No. 2]]) |spawntime = Anytime |respawn = Yes |movement = |detection = |exp = 3,096 |cp = 415 |sp = 5 |gold = 1,330 |hp = 2,908,700 |strength = 1,884 |healing = 384 |dexterity = 281 |agility = 222 |physdef = 10% |ethdef = -10% |critrate = 12% |guardrate = 0% }} '''Creeping Hameel''' is a [[Unique Monster (XC3)|Unique Monster]] in {{XC3}}. It is a member of the [[Flak]] family, and can be found at level 67 at [[Amplifier No. 2]] in the [[Origin Interior]]. The Attack Mastery [[Skill (XC3)|Skill]] can be earned for the [[Soulhacker]] [[Class (XC3)|class]] by defeating it. == Resistances == {{XC3 Resistances |break = 75% |physdebuff = 50% |etherdebuff = 85% |knockback = 100% |blowdown = 100% }} {{clr}} == Gallery == <gallery> Creeping hameel location.png Creeping hameel.png </gallery>
[[Category:XC3 Level 66-70 Enemies]] [[Category:XC3 Unique Monsters]] [[Category:XC3 Flaks]] [[Category:Origin Enemies]] [[Category:XC3 Enemy pages needing drops]]

{{for|the Accessory in {{XC2|-}}|Crimson Headband (XC2)}}
|-|Common = {{Infobox item |name = Crimson Headband |image = XC3 Accessory Cap.png |caption = Boosts Critical Rate by 40%. |type = [[Accessory (XC3)|Accessory]] |xc3rarity = Common |source = |sell = 11,940 [[Gold|G]] }} |-|Rare = {{Infobox item |name = Crimson Headband |image = XC3 Accessory Cap.png |caption = Boosts Critical Rate by 42%. |type = [[Accessory (XC3)|Accessory]] |xc3rarity = Rare |source = |sell = 11,940 [[Gold|G]] }} |-|Legendary = {{Infobox item |name = Crimson Headband |image = XC3 Accessory Cap.png |caption = Boosts Critical Rate by 45%. |type = [[Accessory (XC3)|Accessory]] |xc3rarity = Legendary |source = |sell = 11,940 [[Gold|G]] }}
'''Crimson Headbands''' are [[Accessory (XC3)|Accessories]] in {{XC3}} and {{XC3FR|sublink}}. {{clr}} {{xc3 stub}} {{fr stub}} [[Category:XC3 Accessories]] [[Category:XC3FR Accessories]]

{{Infobox XC3 Status |title = Critical Hit Plus |image = XC3 Critical Hit Plus.png |type = Buff |base-duration = 20.0s |max-duration = 40.0s |rng-applicable = Yes |effect-title-1 = Base Critical Damage Boost |effect-value-1 = 50% }} '''Critical Hit Plus''' is a [[Status Effect]] in {{XC3}} and {{XC3FR|sublink}}. It increases the damage dealt by a character whenever they land a critical hit. The effect works additively, so for example the base 50% boost together with the normal critical damage boost of 25% results in critical hits dealing 75% extra damage.
==Distribution== ===Arts=== *[[Desperate Charge]] ([[Soulhacker]], requires Soul Hacking [[King Krawkin]])
[[Category:XC3 Status]] [[Category:XC3FR Status]]
{{xc3 stub}} {{fr stub}}

{{Infobox XC3 Status |title = Critical Rate Up |image = XC3 Crit rate up.png |type = Buff |base-duration = 20.0s |max-duration = 40.0s |rng-applicable = Yes |effect-title-1 = Base Critical Rate Boost |effect-value-1 = 25% }} '''Critical Rate Up''' is a [[Status Effect]] in {{XC3}} and {{XC3FR|sublink}}. It improves the user's Critical Rate multiplicatively (for example, a character with a Critical Rate of 20% will have their Critical Rate boosted to 25% with the base version of the buff).
==Distribution==
===Arts=== *[[Recharge (XC3)|Recharge]] ([[Yumsmith]], field effect with effect value of 40%) *[[Battle Pheromone]] ([[Soulhacker]], requires Soul Hacking [[Gracious Titania]]) *[[Hair Trigger (XC3)|Hair Trigger]] ([[Sharpshooter]]) *[[Wintry End]] ([[Ethel]]'s [[Chain Attack (XC3)|Chain Order]])
===Skills=== *[[Soulhacker#Enemy Skills|Battle Fever]] (Soulhacker, requires Soul Hacking [[Fleeting Shikino]]; chance-based trigger on enemy defeat)
===Enemy-only Arts=== *Beast Howl ([[Vvarga]] and [[Kananus]] families) *Abyssal Scream ([[Merigna]] and [[Merfrey]] families) *Heat Scream ([[Drague]] family) *Technical Upgrade (certain [[Keves Forces]]) *Round Boost (certain [[Agnus Forces]]) *Gear Shift (Kio, Wira and Graaf [[Droids]]) *Ancestral War Cry ([[Seraphic Ceratinia]], below Lv 200) *Quick Tune-Up ([[Consul Crys]]) *Sensation ([[Moebius R]])
[[Category:XC3 Status]] [[Category:XC3FR Status]]
{{fr stub}}

'''Crushing Weapon Belts''' are [[Accessory (XC3)|Accessories]] in {{XC3}} and {{XC3FR|sublink}}. {{clr}} {{xc3 stub}} {{fr stub}} [[Category:XC3 Accessories]] [[Category:XC3FR Accessories]]

[[file:KingCrustipBoss.png|thumb|King Crustip]] '''Crustips''' are a family of aquatic enemies in the {{XC|serieslink}}, first appearing in {{XC2}}. They resemble large lobster-like creatures, and come in red and blue varieties.
== {{XC2|-}} == Crustips are often encountered after [[Salvaging]]. === Normal Minor Enemies === * [[Bafoo Crustip]] * [[Climber Crustip]] * [[Damodan Crustip]] * [[King Crustip (normal)|King Crustip]] * [[Kran Crustip (XC2)|Kran Crustip]] * [[Krim Crustip]] * [[Nowaak Crustip]] (after salvaging) * [[Pidor Crustip (XC2)|Pidor Crustip]] (after salvaging) * [[Piros Crustip (XC2)|Piros Crustip]] (after salvaging) * [[Redom Crustip]] * [[Sabri Crustip]] (after salvaging)
=== Quest Exclusive Enemies === * [[Naola Crustip (XC2)|Naola Crustip]] (during ''[[Would-Be Mercs]]'') * [[Petra Crustip]] (during ''[[Cargo Escort]]'')
=== Unique Monsters === * [[Demon-Shell Jacob]] * [[Peerless Beaufort]]
=== Boss === * [[King Crustip (boss)|King Crustip]]
=== Challenge Battle Mode Enemy === * [[Spektr Crustip]]
== {{TTGC|-}} == === Normal Minor Enemies === * [[Myrrhes Crustip]] * [[Zafirah Crustip]]
== {{XC3|-}} == === Normal Minor Enemies === * [[Andaris Crustip]] * [[Grandclaw Crustip]] * [[Grauw Crustip]] * [[Hybro Crustip]] * [[Kran Crustip (XC3)|Kran Crustip]] * [[Naola Crustip (XC3)|Naola Crustip]] * [[Nestrand Crustip]] * [[Pidor Crustip (XC3)|Pidor Crustip]] * [[Piros Crustip (XC3)|Piros Crustip]] * [[Purumii Crustip]] * [[Vastclaw Crustip]]
=== Quest Exclusive Enemy === * [[Daedal Crustip]] (During ''[[Culinary Repertoire]]'')
=== Unique Monster === * [[Well-Plated Zelinka]]
== {{XC3FR|sub}} == === Normal Minor Enemies === * [[Naola Crustip (XC3)|Naola Crustip]] * [[Pidor Crustip (XC3)|Pidor Crustip]]
== Gallery == === {{XC2|-}} === <gallery> ClimberCrustip.jpg|Climber Crustip Demon-ShellJacob.jpg|Demon-Shell Jacob PetraCrustip.jpg|Petra Crustip XC2 Bafoo Crustip.jpg|Bafoo Crustip </gallery>

{{spoiler}} {{Infobox Character |name = Crys |image = XC3_Crys.jpg |species = [[Keves]]i human (formerly)
[[Moebius]] |age = |gender = Male |haircolor = Blonde |eyecolor = Silver |affiliation = [[Consul]]s |appearances = {{XC3}}
{{XC3FR|sublink}} (flashback) |voiceactorjp = [[wikipedia:Daisuke Kishio|Daisuke Kishio]] |voiceactoreng = Joe Pitts }} '''Crys''' is a character in {{XC3}}. == Overview == Crys was the personal [[Off-seer]] instructor of [[Noah]], who was in their tenth term who died and was later brought back as a [[Consul]]. 1000 years ago, a previous incarnation of Crys conceived the role of the Off-Seer and the Homecoming Ceremony with the aid of [[M]]. During ''[[Side Story: Noah]]'', Noah senses Crys' presence at [[Keves Castle]] and enters to retrieve the last shard of [[Origin Metal]] necessary to upgrade the [[Bravery]]. The party enters the [[Throne Room (XC3)|Throne Room]], encountering Crys (now Consul C) accompanied by the now known to be false [[Queen of Keves]]. Crys pretends to ally with the fake Queen, only to catch her unawares and destroy her for a final time before confronting the party himself, easily accomplishing a feat that the Ouroboros had previously struggled with. In battle, Crys first fights the party on foot, then hijacks the Queen's own [[Ferronis]] throne and pilots it in an identical manner to her [[Queen of Agnus (boss)|Agnian counterpart]]. After his defeat, Crys shows his respect for Noah and reveals that he had no ill intentions, and Noah successfully retrieves the final piece of Origin metal. {{clr}} == Battle == {{Infobox XC3 Enemy |name = Consul Crys |image = Consul_C-Crys.jpg |caption = Consul Crys |type = [[Consul (enemy)|Consul]] |tab1 = Part 1 |category = [[Quest Exclusive Enemy (XC3)|Quest Exclusive]] [[Boss (XC3)|Boss]] |level = 60 |area = [[Keves Castle]] ([[Throne Room (XC3)|Throne Room]]) |spawntime = During ''[[Side Story: Noah]]'' |respawn = No |movement = Ground |detection = |exp = 3,640 |cp = 108 |sp = 0 |gold = 0 |hp = 2,593,800 |strength = 1,274 |healing = 381 |dexterity = 278 |agility = 205 |physdef = 0% |ethdef = 0% |critrate = 0% |guardrate-front = 15% |guardrate-side = 0% |guardrate-back = 0% |tab2 = Part 2 |category2 = [[Quest Exclusive Enemy (XC3)|Quest Exclusive]] [[Boss (XC3)|Boss]] |level2 = 61 |area2 = [[Keves Castle]] ([[Throne Room (XC3)|Throne Room]]) |spawntime2 = During ''[[Side Story: Noah]]'' |respawn2 = No |movement2 = Air |detection2 = |exp2 = 4,824 |cp2 = 144 |sp2 = 0 |gold2 = 0 |hp2 = 3,544,800 |strength2 = 1,961 |healing2 = 385 |dexterity2 = 262 |agility2 = 156 |physdef2 = 30% |ethdef2 = 0% |critrate2 = 0% |guardrate-front2 = 10% |guardrate-side2 = 10% |guardrate-back2 = 0% }} '''Consul Crys''' is a [[Quest Exclusive Enemy (XC3)|Quest Exclusive]] [[Boss (XC3)|Boss]] who is a [[Consul (enemy)|Consul]] and is fought at level 60 in the [[Throne Room (XC3)|Throne Room]] of [[Keves Castle]] during ''[[Side Story: Noah]]''. He is then fought again afterwards while piloting a [[Ferronis]] at level 61. === Resistances === ==== Part 1 ==== {{XC3 Resistances |break = 80% |topple = 0% |daze = 0% |burst = 0% |launch = 0% |smash = 0% |blowdown = 90% |knockback = 90% |physdebuff = 50% |etherdebuff = Immune }} ==== Part 2 ==== {{XC3 Resistances |break = 85% |blowdown = Immune |knockback = Immune |physdebuff = 50% |etherdebuff = 90% }} === Enraged === ==== Part 1 ==== {|class="xc1 centered" style="width:55%;" !Trigger |Enemy is reduced to 50% HP. |- !Effects |Boosts damage dealt by 25%. |} ==== Part 2 ==== {|class="xc1 centered" style="width:55%;" !Trigger |Enemy is reduced to 50% HP. |- !Effects |style="text-align:left;"|Boosts damage dealt by 25%.
Boosts Art recharge speed by 25%. |} {{clr}} === Arts === ==== Part 1 ==== {|class="xc1 centered" style="width:150%;" !Name !Attribute !Targets !Hits !Power !Reactions/Statuses !Notes !Use Conditions |- |'''''Auto-Attack''''' |Physical |One Target |1 |150% | | |Anytime |- |'''Crescendo Edge''' |Physical |One Target |1 |360% | |style="text-align:left;"| *Critical Rate is boosted by 30%. *Immune to [[Knockback (XC3)|Knockback]] and [[Blowdown (XC3)|Blowdown]] during Art. |Anytime |- |'''Lightning Resonance''' |Ether |Frontward AOE |1 |220% | |style="text-align:left;"| *Immune to Knockback and Blowdown during Art. |Anytime |- |rowspan="2"| '''Staccato Stock''' |rowspan="2"| Physical |rowspan="2"| AOE around User |rowspan="2"| 1 |120% |Knockback / [[Evasion Down]] |style="text-align:left;"| *Immune to Knockback and Blowdown during Art. |When reduced to 80% HP |- |160% |[[Topple (XC3)|Topple]] / Evasion Down |style="text-align:left;"| *Accuracy is boosted by 50%. *Immune to all combos and reactions during Art. *Art is telegraphed 3.0s before execution. |When enraged |- |'''Finale''' |Physical |One Target |4 |160% |[[Launch (XC3)|Launch]] on first hit, [[Smash (XC3)|Smash]] on fourth hit |style="text-align:left;"| *Immune to all combos and reactions during Art. *Each stage of the combo requires the corresponding earlier stage to be inflicted on the target. |When enraged, typically following up Staccato Shock |} ==== Part 2 ==== {|class="xc1 centered" style="width:150%;" !Name !Attribute !Targets !Hits !Power !Reactions/Statuses !Notes !Use Conditions |- |'''''Auto-Attack''''' |Ether |One Target |2 |250% | |style="text-align:left;"| *Critical Rate is boosted by 25%. |Anytime |- |'''Nocturne Sword''' |Ether |One Target |1 |450% |[[Daze (XC3)|Daze]] |style="text-align:left;"| *Accuracy and Critical Rate are both boosted by 50%. *Daze duration is extended by 50%. *Immune to [[Knockback (XC3)|Knockback]] and [[Blowdown (XC3)|Blowdown]] during Art. |Anytime |- |'''Phantasia Rush''' |Ether |Frontward AOE |12 |960% | |style="text-align:left;"| *Critical Rate is boosted by 25%. *Immune to Knockback and Blowdown during Art. *Each hit can only damage a single target in range. |Anytime |- |'''Quick Tune-Up''' |Buff |Self | - | - |[[Critical Rate Up]] / [[Critical Hit Plus]] |style="text-align:left;"| *Buff durations are extended by 200%. *Immune to Knockback and Blowdown during Art. |When reduced to 75% HP |- |'''Rhapsodic Blast''' |Ether |Frontward AOE |4 |220% | |style="text-align:left;"| *Accuracy and Critical Rate are both boosted by 25%. *Immune to Knockback and Blowdown during Art. |Anytime |- |'''Requiem Rain''' |Ether |Frontward AOE |2 |270% |Knockback on first hit / [[Ether Defense Down (XC3)|Ether Defense Down]] |style="text-align:left;"| *Accuracy and Critical Rate are both boosted by 25%. *Immune to Knockback and Blowdown during Art. |When reduced to 50% HP |} == Challenge Battle Mode == {{Infobox XC3 Enemy |name = Consul Crys |image = Consul Crys Archsage's Gauntlet.jpg |caption = Consul Crys |type = [[Consul (enemy)|Consul]] |tab1 = Stage 50 |area = [[Land of Challenge (XC3)|Land of Challenge]] |category = [[Challenge Battle Enemy (XC3)|Challenge Battle Boss]] |level = 90 |spawntime = During ''[[Gauntlet: Pro]]'' |respawn = No |movement = Ground |detection = |hp = 14,512,230 |strength = 4,995 |healing = 4,119 |dexterity = 546 |agility = 391 |physdef = 0% |ethdef = 0% |critrate = 10% |guardrate-front = 15% |guardrate-side = 0% |guardrate-back = 0% |tab2 = Stage 120 |area2 = [[Land of Challenge (XC3)|Land of Challenge]] |category2 = [[Challenge Battle Enemy (XC3)|Challenge Battle Boss]] |level2 = 130 |spawntime2 = During ''[[Gauntlet: Pro]]'' |respawn2 = No |movement2 = Ground |detection2 = |hp2 = 89,515,800 |strength2 = 14,389 |healing2 = 22,055 |dexterity2 = 774 |agility2 = 555 |physdef2 = 0% |ethdef2 = 0% |critrate2 = 10% |guardrate-front2 = 15% |guardrate-side2 = 0% |guardrate-back2 = 0% }} Consul Crys is fought twice during the [[Archsage's Gauntlet]] [[Challenge Battle Mode|Challenge]] ''[[Gauntlet: Pro]]''. He is first fought at Stage 50 at level 90, and later fought alongside [[Queen of Keves (boss)|Queen of Keves]] at Stage 120 at level 130. === Skills === Consul Crys has the following skills: *Deals 10% less damage but takes 30% less damage. === Resistances === {{XC3 Resistances |break = 90% |knockback = 90% |blowdown = 90% |physdebuff = 90% |etherdebuff = 100% }} === Enraged === {|class="xc1 centered" style="width:55%;" !Trigger |Enemy is reduced to 50% HP. |- !Effects |style="text-align:left;"|Boosts damage dealt by 50%.
Boosts Art recharge speed by 50%. |} {{clr}} === Arts === Consul Crys's Arts set is identical to that of his first phase of his boss fight in ''Side Story: Noah'', with the exception of Staccato Shock, whose effects are described here: {|class="xc1 centered" style="width:150%;" !Name !Attribute !Targets !Hits !Power !Reactions/Statuses !Notes !Use Conditions |- |rowspan="2"| '''Staccato Stock''' |rowspan="2"| Physical |rowspan="2"| AOE around User |rowspan="2"| 1 |115% |rowspan="2"| [[Evasion Down]] |style="text-align:left;"| *Accuracy is boosted by 50%. *Removes all buffs from target upon landing a hit. *Immune to Knockback and Blowdown during Art. |When reduced to 80% HP |- |140% |style="text-align:left;"| *Accuracy is boosted by 100%. *Removes all buffs from target upon landing a hit. *Immune to all combos and reactions during Art. |When enraged |} == Gallery == === Artwork === Garvel Crys Concept Art.png|Crys' Concept Art Consuls J S and C.jpg|Consul C Concept Art === Screenshots === Consul C.jpg|Crys with mask {{XC3CharNav}} {{xc3 stub}} [[Category:XC3 Consuls]] [[Category:Keves]] [[Category:XC3 Bosses]] [[Category:XC3 Quest Exclusive Enemies]] [[Category:XC3 Quest Enemies]] [[Category:Keves Castle Region Enemies]] [[Category:XC3 Challenge Battle Bosses]] [[Category:XC3 Consul Enemies]] [[Category:XC3 Level 56-60 Enemies]] [[Category:XC3 Level 61-65 Enemies]] [[Category:XC3 Level 86-90 Enemies]] [[Category:XC3 Level 100+ Enemies]] [[Category:XC3 Enemy pages needing stats]]

{{Infobox XC3 Enemy |category = Unique Monster |name = Crystalline DuGarre |image = XC3 Crystalline DuGarre.png |caption = Crystalline DuGarre |type = [[Ropl]] |level = 27 |area = [[Dannagh Desert (XC3)|Dannagh Desert]] ([[Alefa Skysphere]]) |spawntime = Anytime |respawn = Yes |movement = |detection = |exp = 793 |cp = 520 |sp = 5 |gold = 447 |hp = 517,500 |strength = 500 |healing = 179 |dexterity = 77 |agility = 77 |physdef = 25% |ethdef = -10% |critrate = 8% |guardrate = 10% }} '''Crystalline DuGarre''' is a [[Unique Monster (XC3)|Unique Monster]] in {{XC3}}. It is a member of the [[Ropl]] family, and can be found at level 27 at the [[Alefa Skysphere]] in the [[Dannagh Desert (XC3)|Dannagh Desert]]. The [[Cursed Cuisine]] [[Battle Arts (XC3)|Art]] can be earned by the [[Soulhacker]] [[Class (XC3)|class]] for defeating it. == Resistances == {{XC3 Resistances |break = 50% |physdebuff = 25% |etherdebuff = 30% |knockback = 100% |blowdown = 100%}} {{clr}} == Gallery == <gallery> Crystalline dugarre location.png Crystalline dugarre.png </gallery>

{{spoiler}} {{Infobox Character |name = D |image = XC3 Consul D Portrait Art.png |species = [[Agnus|Agnian]] human (formerly)
[[Moebius]] |aliases = Dirk (originally) |age = |gender = Male |haircolor = Blond |eyecolor = Red |affiliation = [[Agnus]] (formerly)
[[Consul]]s |appearances = {{XC3}} |voiceactorjp = |voiceactoreng= [[wikipedia:Jonathan Slinger|Jonathan Slinger]] }} {{quote|It's a wild ride, this "passage of fate". We got ourselves a nice little awakening.|D}} '''D''' (Japanese: {{Lang|jp|ディー}}, ''Dī'') is a character in {{XC3}}. == Overview == He is a [[Consul]]. He transforms into the [[Mysterious Enemy]] [[Moebius]] that attacks the party and [[Guernica Vandham]].https://www.nintendo.co.jp/switch/az3ha/story/index.html Prior to becoming a Consul, D was known as '''Blackblaze Dirk''', an insane soldier of [[Agnus]] infamous for keeping the heads of his victims as trophies and killing his own men for sport - a hobby which he is eager to continue as a Consul. {{clr}} == Story == [[File:Blackblaze Dirk.jpg|thumb|210px|left|Dirk prior to becoming Moebius]] As an Agnian soldier, Dirk fought with steel claws and took joy in killing not only his [[Keves]]i adversaries but also his own fellow Agnian troops. He kept a collection of the heads of his victims as trophies which earned him the name Blackblaze Dirk and made him an infamous and feared figure among the Agnian [[Colony|Colonies]]. He's even appeared in a textbook, [[Taion]] read it and found out about him. At some point during the war with Keves, Dirk died and chose to become [[Moebius]] in order to continue his sadistic hobby forever, reveling in the "transcendence" that came with being able to remember all of his past kills. As Consul D he was responsible for destroying [[Colony 18]] after it reached Gold rank, killing a past incarnation of [[Eunie]]. [[File:XC3 Mysterious Giant 4.jpg|thumb|210px|D confronts the party as Moebius D & J]] At [[Gura Flava Lowlands]] in [[Alfeto Valley]], D, who has [[Interlink]]ed with Consul [[Joran|J]], impales [[Guernica Vandham]] through the chest before revealing himself to [[Noah]], [[Mio]], and their allies. In an attempt to goad the two squads into fighting him for the [[Ouroboros Stone]], he kills both [[Mwamba]] and [[Hackt]] but before he can face them he is attacked by an injured Guernica piloting his [[Levnis]]. D rips Guernica out of his Levnis and is about to kill him when Noah charges at him and releases Vandham from his grip. As Noah and Mio's squads try their best to fight off D, Guernica activates the Ouroboros Stone, causing Noah and Mio to become [[Ouroboros]] and interlink for the first time. In their new Ouroboros form, Noah and Mio gain the upper hand over D who decides to flee the scene, but not before sending a message to his fellow [[Consul]]s alerting them of the reemergence and allowing them to turn the other humans against them. Upon his return to [[Origin]], D is berated by [[P]] for his failure to defeat Ouroboros but he claims that he did precisely what he was meant to do. After [[K]] is defeated by the party, D criticizes him for putting too much stock in his Irises but is ridiculed by P, [[O]] and [[H]] for retreating during his previous battle. Their argument is interrupted by J who requests to go out alone, to which D agrees. [[File:D Unmasked.jpg|thumb|210px|left|D reveals himself to the party at Keves Castle]] Picking up a reading near [[Keves Castle]], D (interlinked with J) intercepts the party at the [[Annihilator Foundations]]. He cancels his interlink from his Moebius form to reveal that Joran is with him and removes his mask to reveal his face to the party. As D and J battle Eunie and Taion in their Ouroboros form, D notices Eunie's fear and recognizes her as the Colony 18 sharpshooter he killed in a previous incarnation by touching her eye with his claw and turning her to stone. Whilst taunting Eunie, D fails to sense Taion's illusion and is pinned to the ground by Eunie as the [[Annihilator]] is destroyed by Taion's Mondo. With the Annihilator about to explode, D manages to crawl away and cancel his interlink with J, allowing them both to teleport to safety. [[File:D & J Cloudkeep.png|thumb|210px|D and J at the Cloudkeep]] D and J later follow the party into the [[Cloudkeep]], being able to track Mio's movements due to her being half Moebius as a result of merging with [[M]]. As Queen [[Nia]] awakens from her sleep, D in his Moebius form impales her through the chest, seemingly killing her. As the party battle D and J in their Moebius forms, Noah, [[Lanz]] and Eunie attempt to convince Joran to join them. Before Joran can make his choice however, D takes him over by forcing him into an interlink and makes his true thoughts known, calling him a loser. As one final act of defiance, Joran overpowers D and steps backwards over the edge of the Cloudkeep, killing both himself and D in an [[Annihilation Event]]. {{clr}} == Battle == {{Infobox XC3 Enemy 50%.
Boosts Art recharge speed by 50%. |} {{clr}} === Arts === Moebius D's Arts set is identical to that of his boss fight in the main story, with the exception of Dread Edge, whose effects are described here: {|class="xc1 centered" style="width:150%;" !Name !Attribute !Targets !Hits !Power !Reactions/Statuses !Notes !Use Conditions |- |rowspan="2"|'''Dread Edge''' |rowspan="2"|Ether |rowspan="2"|Frontward AOE |6 |540% |rowspan="2"| |style="text-align:left;"| *Immune to Knockback and Blowdown during Art. *Removes all buffs from target upon landing a hit. *Each hit can only damage a single target in range. |While not enraged, after either using Sanguine Fire or if Moebius J is still active |- |12 |900% |style="text-align:left;"| Above notes, plus: *Art is telegraphed 1.5s before execution. |When enraged, after either using Sanguine Fire or if Moebius J is still active |} ==Etymology== The name Dirk is of Dutch origin, deriving from Diederik. The name can be read as “the people’s ruler”, or “gifted ruler”. Additionally, a dirk is a type of dagger. == See also == * [[Moebius D & J]] == Trivia == * D's appearance is almost identical to [[w:c:xenosaga:Grahf|Grahf]] from ''[[w:c:xenosaga:Xenogears|Xenogears]]''. However, his backstory, weapon of choice while he was human, and his role as an initial antagonist are reminiscent of [[Mumkhar]]. == Gallery == === Artwork === XC3 Consul D Art.png|Official art of D D unmasked art.png|Unmasked D concept art.jpg|Concept artwork Weapon Concept 3.png|Concept artwork of Dirk's claws === Screenshots === Moebius D.jpg|D in his Moebius form XC3 Mysterious Giant 5.jpg|D Interlinked with J XC3 Consul D 01.jpg|Consul D, with J standing behind him == References == {{XC3CharNav}} {{xc3 stub}} [[Category:XC3 Consuls]] [[Category:XC3 Bosses]] [[Category:XC3 Quest Exclusive Enemies]] [[Category:XC3 Quest Enemies]] [[Category:Aetia Region Enemies]] [[Category:XC3 Moebius]] [[Category:XC3 Level 51-55 Enemies]] [[Category:XC3 Level 91-95 Enemies]] [[Category:XC3 Level 100+ Enemies]] [[Category:XC3 Challenge Battle Bosses]] [[Category:XC3 Enemy pages needing an infobox image]] [[Category:XC3 Enemy pages needing stats]]
